page.title: 15Buildings - Tudor Grange
page.content: Tudor Grange was built between 1886 and 1899 by the{Lovekins.} Sir Alfred Bird owned the Grange from 1899 to 1922. His widow, Lady Bird, lived there until her death at the age of 92. The Bird family are famous for their custard powder. Solihull U.D.C. bought it in 1947/48 The Red Cross had bought it in 1945 to use as a hospital for the soldiers from the war. The council made it into a special school for mentally handicapped children, but now it is used by Solihull Technical College as part of its campus.
